_group.description: High-level classification of the license family or ecosystem (e.g., Creative Commons, Open Data Commons, government open licenses, open-source, public domain, proprietary).

creative-commons.description: Licenses published by Creative Commons, typically used for content or data.

open-data-commons.description: Licenses from the Open Data Commons (ODC), including ODbL, ODC-By, and PDDL.

government-open-license.description: Licenses published by governments for open data access, such as OGL-UK or Etalab.

open-source.description: Standard open-source software licenses commonly used for software projects.

public-domain.description: Licenses or statements that place the work in the public domain, such as CC0 or the Unlicense.

proprietary.description: Licenses that impose significant restrictions and are not considered open.

_group.description: Describes the primary type of material the license is intended for, such as software, data, content, or documentation.

software.description: Primarily applicable to software or source code.

data.description: Primarily applicable to data sets or databases.

content.description: Primarily applicable to creative works such as text, images, audio, or video.

documentation.description: Primarily used for documentation, manuals, and written guides.

mixed.description: Applies across multiple domains such as software, data, and content.

_group.description: Describes how strongly the license requires sharing modifications or derivative works under similar terms (permissive, weak copyleft, strong copyleft, network copyleft, or none).

permissive.description: Licenses allowing reuse with minimal restrictions, e.g., MIT, BSD, Apache.

weak.description: Copyleft applies only to certain parts or files, e.g., MPL, LGPL.

strong.description: Copyleft requires that derivative works use the same license, e.g., GPL.

network.description: Copyleft obligations also apply when the software is used over a network, e.g., AGPL.

none.description: No copyleft requirements (often public domain or very simple grants).

_group.description: Groups licenses that belong to the same legal family or brand, such as Creative Commons (CC), GPL, MIT, or Apache.

CC.description: Creative Commons family, such as CC-BY, CC-BY-SA, etc.

ODC.description: Open Data Commons license family, including ODbL, ODC-By, and PDDL.

AGPL.description: GNU Affero General Public License family.

LGPL.description: GNU Lesser General Public License family.

Apache.description: Apache License family, including Apache-1.1 and Apache-2.0.

_group.description: Indicates that a license is specific to a country or jurisdiction, such as UK, Norway, or France.

UK.description: United Kingdom localized or government licenses (for example, OGL-UK).

FR.description: French government open data licenses (for example, Licence Ouverte / Etalab).

_group.description: Additional semantic flags that describe important behavioral aspects of a license, such as attribution requirements, share-alike, or custom terms.

attribution-required.description: License requires attribution to the original creator or data provider.

share-alike.description: Derivatives must be licensed under the same or a compatible license.

no-derivatives.description: Users may not distribute derivative works.

includes-patent-grant.description: The license includes an explicit grant of patent rights to downstream users.

must-include-disclaimer.description: The license requires including a disclaimer of warranties or liability.

government-open-license.description: Indicates the license is a government open license with special terms or obligations.

custom-terms.description: The license contains custom, non-standard, or unusual terms not fully covered by other tags.

_group.description: Metadata that reflects how the license is classified in the SPDX list, such as OSI approval, FSF status, or deprecation.

osi-approved.description: The license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).

fsf-free.description: The license is classified as free by the Free Software Foundation.

deprecated.description: This license identifier is deprecated in the SPDX list and should not be used for new content.
